is pcmcia or USB?

yeah PCI (:
in a terminal type "lspci -v" (without quotes)
ok done (:
what did the entry for your wireless adapter say?
should I be looking at 'ethernet controller: marvell techology group ltd 88e8038 PCI-E fast ey hernet controller' or 'ethernet controller: atheros comunications inc AR5001 Wireless network adapter' ?
ah atheros!
type "lsmod" and  you will get a listing of all the modules loaded - you need to look for atheros and see what adapter it is using now
actually "lsmod | less" so you can scroll through

-> Ethernet controller: Atheros Communications Inc. AR5001 Wireless network Adapter (rev 01) - Subsystem: AMBIT Microsystem Corp. Device 0428 - Flags: bus master, fast devsel, latency 0 IRQ 17  Memory at 44400000 (64bit, non-prefetchable) [size=64k] - Capabilities: <access denied> - Kernel driver in use: ath5k - Kernel modules: ath5k
so its using ath5k now and dropping your connection...
yeah its really slow and dropping the connection every 2mins ):
install linux-backports-modules-wireless-lucid-generic - some people report this works
